column4: hey guys... I think I have a serious problem... the sound volume all of a sudden became very low and this is happening both in windows and ubuntu! what could be my problem?
what could have caused it?
maybe accidentally swapped line-out, spk-out ports?
how?
some cards come with amplified/non amplified jacks
I only have jacks for mic and external speakers / headphones. I can hear the sound, very low, if i use my ext. speakers but the pc's own speakers are completely mute
mmm try in a terminal running "alsamixer"
anyway, I don't see how I could've swapped anything, do you mean something like connecting the ext. speakers to the wrong jack? or something software related?
already tried alsamixer, I only have one bar, "master", and it is full (100)
if you press tab it'll show you other channels
also, it says card:PulseAudio, I'm not sure this is meant to be... but still, it doesnt work on windows either
I only have "master" and "capture"
that's what i suggested indeed, it has happened to me to plug non-amplified speakers to "line-out" and ending with no amplification at all
I doubt this was it since it started happening earlier today, while I had no speakers connected
waldir, maybe it's an error with pulseaudio try restarting it. Have you rebooted and the problem persists?
yes, and in windows too :(

i suspect it might have to do with me turning off the sound with the laptop's integrated volume knob while ubuntu was starting earlier today, to avoid playing the logon sound since i was in a class. this is the only unusual sound-related thing I recall doing prior to this happening..
have you tried opening the GUI mixer?
it has two tabs
alsamixergui? or the volume control?
volume control
two tabs?
one tab has all the sliders for each channel, the other one should say "switches" or something like that
aargh... I gotta leave for a sec, brb
